huntYears.SEASON_DATE_TEXT: Valid for the season/weapon listed on your qualifying permit on the Chalk Creek, East Canyon, Henry Mtns, Morgan-S. Rich, Pine Valley, W. Desert Tintic Valley, W. Desert-Vernon & Zion Units
huntYears.NOTES: Antlerless control permits will be available beginning July 21 at 8am. Customers who already possess a qualifying big game permit will have a 'Special Offer' listed in the online license sales system after logging in.

huntBios.GENERAL_INFORMATION:
The Division wants to provide more hunting opportunities on units where it is difficult to harvest antlerless elk. To provide this opportunity, the Division issues antlerless elk-control permits. You may only obtain an antlerless elk-control permit if you have a buck, bull or once-in-a-lifetime permit for areas that overlap antlerless elk-control hunting units.

If you obtained a permit (including general season) to harvest a buck, bull or once-in-a-lifetime species on any of the above units (CWMU permits are no longer included), you have the option of purchasing an antlerless elk-control permit.

The antlerless elk-control permit allows you to harvest an antlerless elk in the same unit where you’ll already be hunting an antlered big game animal. Antlerless elk-control permits are not valid statewide. Please verify all hunt boundaries before heading into the field. You may hunt the antlerless elk only during the season dates—and with the same weapon—listed on your buck, bull or once-in-a-lifetime permit.

Example 1: If you have a permit to hunt buck deer on the Pine Valley unit, you may purchase an antlerless elk-control permit and harvest an antlerless elk on the Pine Valley unit during your deer hunt.

Example 2: If you have an any bull elk permit and you’re hunting on the Morgan, South Rich unit, you can obtain an antlerless elk-control permit. You can harvest a bull elk anywhere on the unit, but you may only harvest an antlerless elk within the Morgan, South Rich elk-control unit.

NOTE:If you harvest with your buck, bull or OILT permit before harvesting with your antlerless control permit, your antlerless control permit remains valid for the remainder of the season listed on your qualifying buck, bull or OILT permit.

huntMaster.SPECIAL_PROVISIONS: PLEASE NOTE: Antlerless elk control permits are NOT valid on CWMU's
huntMaster.NOTES:
Please be aware that the DWR may be conducting aerial surveys or big game captures during the season dates of this hunt.
Baiting big game for the purposes of hunting is now illegal in Utah.
Click here for more information.

The use of all trail cameras (including both non-handheld transmitting and non-transmitting devices) in the harvest or to aid in the harvest of big game is prohibited between July 31 and Dec. 31. Click here for more information.
huntMaster.HARVEST_REPORTING: Voluntary: Hunters who obtain this permit are encouraged, but not required, to submit a harvest report. Report your harvest online or by calling 1-800-221-0659.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Very limited, except in the Whitney reservoir area.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Chalk Creek road near Coalville, Utah. Highway 150 south of Evanston Wyoming.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kings Peak, Ogden, Salt Lake City. USFS Kamas Ranger District map
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Very Limited except for USFS land near Whitney Resivoir
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Primarily private land--Summit and Duchesne counties--Boundary begins at I-84 and I-80 near Echo; northeast on I-80 to the Utah-Wyoming state line; southeast along this state line to SR-150; south on SR-150 to Pass Lake and the Weber River trail; west on this trail to Holiday Park and CR 2596 (Weber Canyon road); west on this road to SR-32; northwest on SR-32 to I-80 at Wanship; north on I-80 to I-84 near Echo. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Kings Peak, Ogden, Salt Lake City. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, (801) 476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The majority of land is managed by the BLM. The National Park Service manages Glen Canyon National Recreation Area and Horse Shoe National Park. These areas are interspersed with SITLA land. There is is also private land on Mt. Ellen, Mt. Hillers, and leased land on Mt. Holmes.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: There are no DWR Wildlife Management Areas
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: There are three managed campgrounds on the Henry Mtns. Two on Mt Ellen: Lonesome Beaver and McMillan, and Mt. Hillers: Star Springs. Direct questions regarding maps and camping regulations to the Hanksville BLM Field Office. http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/richfield/recreation_/henry_mountains.html
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS:
Deer, Bison, Elk: There are several Henry Mountain access roads. Mount Ellen can be accessed on the North from the Sawmill Basin road, travel south on 100 East in Hanksville. Access to the east side of Mt Ellen is from the Little Egypt road at mile marker 20 off of SR95. Access to the west side of Ellen and Pennell is off the Notom/Burr Trail road, turn east at the Sandy Ranch. The east side of Mount Pennell and the north side of Mount Hillers can be accessed from the Coyote Benches/Stanton Pass road off of SR276. The east and south side of Mount Hillers can be accessed from the Star Springs road also off of SR276. All these roads connect with each other so there is general access to various areas across the mountain range.The BLM has put up good signage to get you around.

Desert Bighorn Sheep: Some of the best access is from Lake Powell on the east side of the unit. From the lake you can access Trachyte, Two Mile, Four Mile, Peshliki, and Ticaboo drainages. SR95 through North Wash follows along the North side of the unit and hwy 276 which travels along the west side of Mt. Holmes and Elsworth and the east side Mt. Hillers. From the map you will see a few stem roads going east off of SR276. One accesses Trachyte Point for about 3 miles where it ends above Hog Springs. Another road stems towards Mt. Holmes and Fred Ridge but this soon dead ends at a private property gate. Another road stems also to Mt. Ellsworth. Ticaboo Mesa is also accessed from SR276, this road runs along the southern side of Mt. Ellsworth and overlooks the canyon forks of Ticaboo Creek and other canyons and mesas to the North.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS:
The following link on the BLM website provides a good map of the general boundaries of the five BLM Wilderness Study Areas (WSAs) located in the hunt unit surrounding the Henry Mountains, as well as the motorized travel designations which presently exist on public lands in this area. This map is available at: https://www.blm.gov/sites/blm.gov/files/uploads/BLMUtahHenryMountainsMap.pdf
USGS maps are available at the BLM in Hanksville: USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Escalante, Hanksville, Hite Crossing, and Loa. They have a general map that labels most of the main roads. The BLM also has good road signage to help you navigate.
huntBoundaryInfos.COUNTY_ROAD_INFO:
Emery County: http://www.emerycounty.com/road/contact.htm
Wayne County: http://www.waynecountyutah.org/
Garfield County: http://garfield.utah.gov/
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Deer and Bison: 4 wheel drive is highly recommended on the Henry Mountains. Roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM, Wayne and Garfield counties, and SITLA, and regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans. The Cave Flat road has a temporary closure November 1st – May 15th. Direct questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the Hanksville BLM Field Office, SITLA, and the county you are traveling. http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/richfield/recreation_/henry_mountains.html

Desert Bighorn: The few stem roads east off of SR276 would be best with an ATV. Direct questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the Hanksville BLM Field Office, SITLA, and the county you are traveling.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES:
The boundary excludes all of the Capital Reef National Park (CRNP). CRNP strictly regulates all hunting activity and access through the Park which is limited to the Swap Canyon trail on foot or by horse. At the end of the Cow Bison Orientation is detailed information about bison hunting and CRNP. You can see the orientation here. Contact Capital Reef National park for more information. http://www.nps.gov/care/contacts.htm

There is private property on both Mount Ellen and Mount Hillers. Mount Holmes also has private leased property. Written permission from the landowner/lessee is required by law to access and hunt private land.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Garfield, Kane and Wayne counties--Boundary begins on SR-95 at a point two miles south of Hanksville; south on SR-95 to Lake Powell; south along the west shore of Lake Powell to SR-276 at Bullfrog; north on SR-276 to the Burr Trail-Notom road; north on this road to the Capitol Reef National Park boundary; north on this boundary to the Burr Trail-Notom road at The Narrows and Divide Canyon; north on this road to a point two miles south of SR-24; east along a line that is two miles south of SR-24 to SR-95. EXCLUDES ALL NATIONAL PARKS. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Escalante, Hanksville, Hite Crossing, Loa. Boundary questions? Call the Price office, 435-613-3700.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Both public and private land exists check land maps for specific details.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: There are no WMA within the hunt area
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Mostly primitive camping on unit. There is a campground located at Vernon Reservoir
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Multiple options, see map for details
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Rush Valley, Lynndyl, Nephi, and Provo
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Much of the hunt area is open to ATV use, consult BLM for travel restrictions.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES:
Public land are administered out of the BLM Fillmore Field Office
http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/fillmore.html
Bureau of Land Management
Fillmore Field Office
95 East 500 North
Fillmore, Utah 84631
Phone: (435) 743-3100

Cropland is closed, unless written permission is granted.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Juab, Millard ,Tooele and Utah Counties—Boundary begins at I-15 and SR-73 in Lehi; south on I-15 to Exit 207 and Mills Road; west on this road to the Sevier River; northwest along this river to SR-132; west on SR-132 to US-6; southwest on US-6 to SR-174 (Brush Wellman/IPP Road); northwest on SR-174 to the Dugway Valley Road; north on this road to the Pony Express Road; northeast on this road to SR-36; north on SR-36 to the Faust Junction and Pony Express Road; east on the this road to SR-73; east on SR-73 to I-15 in Lehi. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Delta, Fish Springs, Lynndyl, Manti, Nephi, Provo, Rush Valley. Boundary questions? Call the Springville office, 801-491-5678.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Campgrounds can be found on the Forest Service along the Monte Cristo Highway. Please visit https://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf for more details
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: Use Hwy 39 to access Forest Service land. Use  I-84  and exit onto Henefer Rd or Echo Rd to access Henefer/Echo WMA
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Limited ATV access south of Hwy 39 on Forest Service.  No motorized vehicles on Henefer Echo WMA
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Morgan, Rich, Summit and Weber counties--Boundary begins at I-80 and the Utah-Wyoming state line; west on I-80 to Echo Junction and I-84; west on I-84 to SR-167 at Mountain Green (Trappers Loop Road); north along SR-167 to SR-39; east along SR-39 to Woodruff and SR-16; southeast on SR-16 to the Utah-Wyoming state line; south along the state line to I-80. Excludes all CWMUs. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property.  Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Logan, Ogden. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Check with Forest Service.  Mostly just the Wastach front
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Davis, Morgan, Salt Lake and Summit counties--Boundary begins at Echo Junction and I-80; southwest along I-80 to I-15; north on I-15 to its junction with I-84 near Ogden; east on I-84 to Echo Junction. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Salt Lake City, Ogden. Boundary questions? Call the Ogden office, 801-476-2740.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Please direct all questions regarding maps and camping regulations to the Kanab and St George BLM Field Offices.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: BLM: Kanab, St George, Cedar City
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM and SITLA and regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the Kanab and St George BLM Field Office.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: This unit is largely private land.  Make sure you have written permission before entering private land.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Iron, Kane and Washington counties—Boundary begins at the Utah-Arizona state line and I-15; north on I-15 to SR-14; east on SR-14 to US-89; south on US-89 to US-89A; south on US-89A to the Utah-Arizona state line; west on this state line to I-15. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Excludes Zion National Park. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Cedar City, Kanab, Panguitch, Saint George. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Land Ownership: Public, Private, State Trust Lands (SITLA). The public lands are Bureau of Land Management (BLM) and Dixie National Forest managed out of the Cedar City and St. George Field Offices, respectively. Ninety percent of the deer habitat is on public lands. There is one CWMU on the unit. The New Harmony CWMU is for deer and turkey. Information on maps can be found at: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/res/utah_public_room/maps.print.html http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/dixie/maps-pubs
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
There are BLM and USFS campgrounds on the unit. Baker Dam campground for BLM lands is near Veyo. Some campgrounds on USFS land are Oak Grove, Honeycomb Rocks, and Pine Valley reservoir. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the BLM and the USFS. Cedar City and St. George BLM website: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/cedar_city/recreation.html
St. George Forest Service website: http://www.fs.usda.gov/activity/dixie/recreation/ohv
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: Information on maps can be found at: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/res/utah_public_room/maps.print.html http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/dixie/maps-pubs
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: Stay on existing roads and trails. All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM and the Dixie National Forest and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to BLM and USFS. http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/moab/recreation/motorized_routes/ohv_designations.html http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/st__george/recreation/motorized_recreation.html http://www.fs.usda.gov/activity/dixie/recreation/ohv
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The Shivwit Piute Tribe owns a large property west of Ivins.  This is primarily on deer winter range and would only be a factor during the any weapon deer hunt.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Iron and Washington counties—Boundary begins at the Utah-Arizona state line and I-15; north on I-15 to SR-56; west on SR-56 to the Lund highway; northwest on this highway to Lund and the Union Pacific railroad tracks; southwest along these tracks to the Utah-Nevada state line; south on this state line to the Utah-Arizona state line; east on this state line to I-15. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Caliente, Cedar City, Clover Mountains, Saint George. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.
